name: Applesoft BASIC
description: A version of BASIC designed by Microsoft for the Apple II computer

functions.name: atn
functions.description: Calculates angle corresponding with a tan ratio.  The resulting angle is measured in radians.

functions.name: cos
functions.description: Calculates cos of an angle that is measured in radians

functions.name: for
functions.description: Marks the start of a for-loop

functions.name: hplot
functions.description: Draws a line between specified points.  For example, HPLOT x1,y1 to x2,y2 draws a line connecting point (x1y1) to (x2,y2)

functions.name: htab
functions.description: Similar to vtab, htab controls where text is to start printing.

functions.name: sin
functions.description: Calculates sin of an angle that is measured in radians

functions.name: tan
functions.description: Calculates tan of an angle that is measured in radians

functions.name: vtab
functions.description:
Prints text on any of the 24 available lines of output.  For example, VTAB 10
PRINT "HI" would print hi on line 10.
